text: <@U0UHG4VP1> I think we should amend the policy on blockchain-explorer repo to NACR until the project gets more maintainers and into a groove.
<@U11HH3P7Y> we just agreed on the TSC call to disable the fabric behave tests temporarily until we can stabilize them. Could you please stub them out for the time being?
<@U0KN2SSKE> will work with Jeff on a plan to get them restored once stable.
ok <@U0KM61BCP> will do that
thanks
<@U0UHG4VP1> would you please create a repository ‘fabric-sdk-py’ with NACR policy for the newly approved fabric- python sdk
<@U0UHG4VP1> : pls kill <https://jenkins.hyperledger.org/job/fabric-verify-x86_64/1016/>
<@U0KPFAZNF> : Shall I kill #1016 build?
y
it was a bad push, no sense wasting the CI resources
ok done
ty
ty <@U11HH3P7Y>
<@U11HH3P7Y> <@U0UHG4VP1> <https://jenkins.hyperledger.org/job/fabric-verify-x86_64/1014/> seems to have been running almost 3 hours now - behave finished but seems hung
yes.
I will cancel this build now.. I will submit a patch to stop/cancel the builds if it takes more time..
<@U0UHG4VP1>: Jeff suggested me to upgrade grpcio package to 1.0.0 in Jenkins machine. I have updated bootstrap.sh with this change.. Could you please check this
ramesh have you tested this change in the jjb sandbox to make sure it works OK?
No.. I haven't implemented that jenkins ci setup for sanbox repo..
so is this a change I need to make to the image itself, or is this script run when openstack instantiates the VM?
looks like the image itself
since this will impact 100% of our CI could you check with hgabor to make sure this doesn’t break fabric-api?
Will check with <@U1AU8DRQR> and let you know
OK
Chris suggested me to disable `behave tests ` in CI for time being.. I have submitted patch in ci-management.. Could you please review
I left a question on it

<@U0KM61BCP> fabric-sdk-py now has NACR enabled. Do you want the same for fabric-test-resources ? I still need a list of committers for f-t-r. I commented on <https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-297>
<@U11HH3P7Y> merged
Thanks <@U0UHG4VP1>

If the BDD tests are being disabled for now is there some way of still running them in Jenkins? Even manually. In my experience the tests are OK locally, they just have trouble in Jenkins (presumably with the extra load).
jcarrivick you could create a separate job that doesn’t vote, I suppose. If nobody is checking the results I don’t see the value
Well I was more thinking that the disabling is temporary and we'd need some way of validating the stability is improved before we re-enable them
so that’s what I just proposed - create a new job that just runs those tests, but don’t enable voting for it.
<@U1M7K67EV> you might work with <@U11HH3P7Y> on how exactly to disable voting. I also would not spend any time worrying about s390 jobs, as there is no push to re-enable them
Ok thanks ry, I'll do that
<@U0UHG4VP1> f-t-r same set of maintainers as fabric please 2+2
<@U0KM61BCP> OK.
<@U11HH3P7Y> how would I check the version of gprcio installed on a machine?
pip show grpcio
looks like it isn’t installed, perhaps bootstrap.sh didn’t get run.
I need to focus on something else for an hour or so, but I will try to get this gprcio image built tonight
or Friday
ok
how critical is this particular item?
tomorrow is fine.. That's what I head from jeff..
cbf: NACR is now enabled on fabric-sdk-py and blockchain-explorer. 2+2 is enabled for f-t-r
danke <@U0UHG4VP1>
<@U11HH3P7Y> when you can, could you update <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/845/5> to elide the behave tests?
